DOC.brief_summary: Sublingual misoprostol is superior to oxytocin in reduction of blood loss during the third and fourth stages of labor
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Sublingual Misoprostol and Intravenous Oxytocin in Active Management of the Third Stage of Labor
DOC.detailed_description: Sublingual misoprostol is superior to oxytocin in reduction of blood loss during the third and fourth stages of labor as The data from a pharmacokinetics study suggested that the bioavaiblitiy of misoprostol after sub-lingual administration was higher than those after oral or vaginal administration
DOC.criteria: Women with aheathy singleton pregnancy in spontaneous or induced labor at term . Hypersensitivity/Contraindication to prostaglandins Antepartum hemorrhage Multiple pregnancy Cardiac disease Malpresentation Rhesus negative mother hypersensitive disorders Severe anaemia(hemoglobin<7g/dl)
